175.article_body: An Indian Air Force officer and his family, stuck inside their SUV, which was sinking due to flooding near Pune's Harris Bridge, were rescued along with their pet dog by the fire brigade on Wednesday. The IAF officer's children reportedly climbed atop the vehicle as water levels rose. Fire brigade officials used safety ropes to rescue the family.

176.title: Kevin Spacey pleads not guilty to sex offence charges in UK, to go on trial next year
176.article_body: Actor Kevin Spacey has pleaded not guilty to four charges of sexually assaulting three men and a fifth charge of causing a person to engage in penetrative sexual activity without consent at London's Old Bailey. Police said the alleged assaults occurred between 2005 and 2013. Spacey will now go on trial in London, beginning on June 6 next year.

177.title: Pictures of Deepika Padukone's lookalike Rijuta Ghosh Deb go viral
177.article_body: Pictures of Rijuta Ghosh Deb have gone viral, with several social media users calling her Deepika Padukone's lookalike. Rijuta describes herself as a digital creator on her Instagram bio. "At first I thought she's Deepika Padukone," a comment on one of her posts read. "Deepika Padukone's doppelganger," an Instagram user wrote while another comment read, "You look like Deepika Padukone."

178.title: 23-yr-old kickboxer Nikhil dies after getting punched during championship in Bengaluru
178.article_body: A 23-year-old kickboxer named Nikhil passed away at a hospital after getting punched during a state-level K1 kickboxing championship in Bengaluru. The Bengaluru police have registered a case of negligence against the organisers of the competition. A video from the event shows Nikhil collapsing in the ring after getting punched in the face by his opponent.

179.title: I switch off the TV after a point: Ravichandran Ashwin on ODI cricket
179.article_body: Talking about the state of ODI cricket, Ravichandran Ashwin said, "Greatest beauty of one-day cricket is...sorry...was...ebbs and flows of the game." He added, "People used to bide their time and take the game deep." Ashwin stated, "Even me...as a cricket badger and a cricket nut...I switch off the TV after a point and that's frankly very scary for the format."

180.title: Thane's Ulhas river water level comes down from danger level
180.article_body: The water level of Ulhas river, which reached 17.70 metres on Wednesday crossing the danger level, came down to 14.90 metres on Thursday morning. The rural areas of Badlapur and Kalyan talukas were alerted after the water level increased. Around 300 riverside residents were shifted to safer places and those having riverside houses were instructed to move to upper floors.

181.title: England gift jersey to 6-yr-old girl who was hit by Rohit's six, pic goes viral
181.article_body: England gifted their jersey to the six-year-old girl who was hit by Rohit Sharma's 79-metre six during the first ODI at The Oval in London. A picture of the girl holding a brand new England jersey has gone viral on social media. "Laudable gesture," a fan commented on the viral picture.

182.title: Trump called witness who is yet to appear before committee investigating Jan 6 riots
182.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump called a witness who is yet to appear before a congressional committee investigating the January 6 US Capitol attack. The witness did not pick up Trump's call but did tell their lawyer. "We will take any effort to influence witness testimony very seriously," the committee said.

183.title: Plants bud in newly asphalted road in B'luru; BBMP faces criticism
183.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is facing criticism from the residents after plants sprouted from a newly asphalted road in Varthur. The civic body had spent ₹24 crores on the road, which was laid just 10 days ago. The residents alleged that the soil under it wasn't cleared before asphalting, hence the seeds germinated with plants sprouting from it.

184.title: Priest begins protest outside Hong Kong jail for release of activists
184.article_body: A Catholic priest launched a three-day protest outside a maximum security prison in Hong Kong on Thursday. Franco Mella, a longtime rights activist in the Chinese-ruled city, is demanding the release of activists and democratic politicians held under a national security law. The 74-year-old has pledged not to eat for the entire duration of his protest.

185.title: Water storage in Pune dams rises as rains continue to lash city
185.article_body: The water storage in all four dams upstream of the Mutha river in Pune has increased to 14.11 TMC as heavy rains continue to lash the city. The Panshet area witnessed 128 mm rainfall and Khadakwasla 54 mm rainfall in the last 24 hours. The Khadakwasla dam is filled to capacity and water is being released to Mutha river.

186.title: Russia's economic shock to blame for Sri Lanka crisis: Zelenskyy
186.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has blamed Russia for creating an "economic shock" by blocking food exports amid the Ukraine war, which he said led to crisis in Sri Lanka. "Shocking food and fuel price hikes led to...social explosion [in Sri Lanka]," he added. Zelenskyy also said that disruption in the global supply chain of these products has benefited Russia's agenda.

187.title: #Bazball: Jimmy Neesham reacts to his 91-run knock in county match
187.article_body: Reacting to a video of his shots from his 91-run innings for Northamptonshire, New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham tweeted, "#Bazball". The term 'Bazball' is being used for England's aggressive approach in Test cricket. Neesham slammed 11 fours and two sixes in his 91-run innings off 101 balls in a recent county match.

188.title: Father, 2 friends get 20-yr jail for gang-rape of minor daughter in Mumbai
188.article_body: A father and his two friends have been convicted to 20 years in jail for gang-rape of his 16-year-old daughter in Mumbai over a period of two months in 2018. The father was earlier in jail in an attempt to murder case. The victim claimed her father had begun sexually assaulting her a few days after his return from jail.

189.title: Bomb squad deployed as suspicious cylinder found in J&K's Akhnoor
189.article_body: A suspicious cylinder was found in the Akhnoor sector of Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday, the local police said. Bomb squad and police have been deployed at the spot. More details are awaited. This comes after police and security forces defused a gas cylinder fitted with five-kg firecrackers in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Tuesday.

190.title: 3 people injured in leopard attack in Rajasthan's Jaipur
190.article_body: Three villagers were injured after a leopard attacked them in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Thursday. According to police, the leopard had entered the village at around 2:30 am. It later entered a building of the Apex University following which it was tranquillised by a forest department team, police added. One of the victims suffered serious injuries, said SHO Dilip Singh.

191.title: SRK not factor behind quitting 'Dunki', he's too much of a gentleman: DOP
191.article_body: Amit Roy, who recently quit as the Director of Photography of 'Dunki', has said that the film's lead actor Shah Rukh Khan was not the factor behind quitting the film. "It was a thing between a director and DOP. SRK is anyway too gentlemanly to get into that relationship," he added. The film is directed by Rajkumar Hirani.

192.title: Trained extensively for Bihari dialect: Janhvi on her role in Good Luck Jerry
192.article_body: Speaking about her role in 'Good Luck Jerry', actress Janhvi Kapoor said she trained extensively for 'Bihari' accent. "I trained extensively for the Bihari dialect. I was made to do an exercise wherein [my coach] would make me say Bihari abuses as a part of the training," she added. "The whole process was...lot of fun eventually," Janhvi said.

193.title: England shouldn't think of scoring 350 right from start: RP Singh
193.article_body: Ahead of the second ODI between England and India, ex-cricketer RP Singh has said England shouldn't think of scoring 350 right from the start and need to "change their template a bit". He added, "[England] will have to assess the conditions first and then adjust." India dismissed England for 110 runs and won the first ODI by 10 wickets.

194.title: Won't support any law that mandates 2 children: Owaisi
194.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that he will not support any law that mandates two children only policy as it would not benefit the country. "We should not repeat the mistakes of China...India's total fertility rate is declining, by 2030 it will stabilise," he added. Earlier, he criticised UP CM Yogi Adityanath over his "population imbalance" remark.

195.title: 4 hospitals ordered to shut permanently after 16-yr-old was forced to sell her eggs in TN
195.article_body: Four hospitals in Tamil Nadu were ordered to shut permanently by the state health department for their alleged involvement in sale of egg cells of a 16-year-old. The girl was forced by her mother to sell her egg cells eight times. "Aadhaar card was forged to show the minor...as...adult. A fictitious husband's consent was obtained," the state Health Minister said.

196.title: Depends on book in Parliament that decides on words being unparliamentary: Kharge
196.article_body: Reacting to a list of words that are now banned in Parliament, Congress’ Mallikarjun Kharge said it depends on book in the Parliament that decides on words being unparliamentary. "We'll use those words that he (PM Modi) had used in his parliamentary career, we'll tell him what words he used in debates. He himself used these words," Kharge added.

197.title: Patralekhaa putting sindoor on me on our wedding was impulsive: Rajkummar
197.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao, opening up about his wife Patralekhaa putting sindoor on him on their wedding day, has said that none of them had planned it. "We both are equal and that's how it should be. So, yeah, it was very impulsive...I am glad it happened and I am hoping that somewhere it [struck] people's hearts," he further added.

198.title: India announce their squad for T20I series against West Indies, Kohli not included
198.article_body: India have announced their squad for the T20I series against West Indies. Virat Kohli and Jasprit Bumrah have not been included in the squad, while KL Rahul and Kuldeep Yadav have been included subject to fitness. The squad also includes Ravichandran Ashwin, Ravi Bishnoi, Harshal Patel, Arshdeep Singh and Avesh Khan.

199.title: Man kidnaps & rapes 13-year-old girl in Gurugram; booked
199.article_body: Police have booked a man for allegedly raping a 13-year-old girl in Gurugram. The accused, who lives in the same neighbourhood, had allegedly been raping her for two months. "She said that he had threatened to kill her family if she revealed it to anyone," her father claimed. He also alleged that the accused had kidnapped her on July 8.

200.title: I sprained my neck a week before the shoot: Dhanush on 'The Gray Man'
200.article_body: Dhanush, who will next be seen in 'The Gray Man', revealed he sprained his neck a week before filming began. "I...was like 'What am I going to do?' The physio had..a week's time to get me ready to match Ana De Armas' speed," he stated. "Somehow, they found a way to make me fit for the stunt sequence," he added.

201.title: India will struggle if they look at Hardik as their 5th bowler: Nehra
201.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said Team India will struggle if they are considering all-rounder Hardik Pandya as their fifth bowler in ODIs. "He can only be your sixth bowler," added Nehra. "Hardik [won't go]...to...West Indies for [the] ODIs which is good," he stated. Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar had earlier said he's worried about the all-rounder bowling 10 overs in ODIs.

202.title: Hyd police arrests 1 person for procuring fake educational certificates
202.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Wednesday said that it has arrested one person for procuring fake educational certificates. Police also seized fake marksheets and certificate of Himalayan University from the accused. According to police, the accused works at an IT company in Hyderabad. He did not complete his graduation and had thus obtained the fake certificates by paying ₹75,000, police added.

203.title: FM has called planets to rescue the economy: P Chidambaram
203.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram said, "We're not surprised that Finance Minister tweeted pictures of Jupiter, Pluto and Uranus on the day when inflation printed at 7.01% and unemployment printed at 7.8%," he tweeted. "To begin with, she should appoint new CEA: Chief Economic Astrologer," he added. "The FM has called the planets to...rescue of the economy," he further added.

204.title: Ever tried putting lion on leash, it breaks: Cong's Manish Tewari
204.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari on Wednesday tweeted, "Ever tried putting a lion on a leash? Only one thing happens, the leash breaks." Earlier, Tewari refused to sign a letter by the Opposition against the Agnipath scheme. Tewari, who was one of the Opposition MPs to meet Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, didn't sign letter that sought withdrawal or scrutiny of scheme.

205.title: You cannot drop Virat Kohli straightaway: Ashish Nehra
205.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's current form, ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said, "You cannot just drop him straightaway because of his lack of runs." Nehra stated, "He has scored ample runs in international cricket and has done so much for the country." Nehra further stated, "Yes...he hasn’t been consistent and he himself would be knowing...he hasn’t performed up to his calibre."

206.title: Biggest Supermoon of 2022 lights up night skies around the world, pics surface
206.article_body: The biggest Supermoon of 2022 lit up night skies around the world, with the Moon being closest to the Earth at a distance of 3,57,264 km. The July 13 full Moon is also called the Buck Moon because the antlers of bucks or male deer normally grow around this time, as per The Old Farmer's Almanac.

207.title: Next we'll be asked to wear saffron dress: Adhir on 'unparliamentary' words list
207.article_body: Reacting to the new list of unparliamentary words released by Lok Sabha Secretariat, Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said that Centre is making a "second republic" by bringing such rules. "At present, they (Centre) are saying that certain words can't be used inside Parliament, tomorrow they'll ask to enter premises in a saffron dress," the Congress leader said.

208.title: Petrol price cut by ₹5 per litre, diesel price by ₹3 per litre in Maharashtra
208.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Thursday announced that the price of petrol and diesel in the state will be reduced by ₹5 per litre and ₹3 per litre respectively. This comes days after the Chief Minister said that his government will cut VAT on fuel to provide relief to the people of Maharashtra.

209.title: Curfew imposed in Colombo till Friday morning to prevent further unrest
209.article_body: Sri Lanka's acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe has imposed a curfew in Colombo from 12 pm on July 14 to 5 am on July 15 in a bid to prevent further unrest. Wickremesinghe was appointed as acting President after Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country with his wife amid mass protests over the economic crisis. Protesters are also demanding Wickremesinghe's resignation.

210.title: Big-screen offerings remain my main focus: Ranveer on his OTT debut
210.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who recently made his OTT debut with 'Ranveer vs Wild', has said that he is most comfortable playing characters in theatres. "The big-screen offerings remain my main focus," he stated. Ranveer added, "That said, I'm grateful that the OTT platform has offered me the opportunity to endear myself and entertain the audience."

211.title: 10-yr-old rape victim went to neighbouring state to end pregnancy after US abortion ban
211.article_body: Ohio police have confirmed that a 10-year-old rape victim crossed state lines to terminate her pregnancy after the US Supreme Court overturned a federal right to abortion care. A 27-year-old man from Columbus, Ohio was arrested on July 12 and charged with raping the girl. The girl received an abortion in Indianapolis, Indiana on June 30.

212.title: Rohit, Dhawan made it look so easy on a difficult pitch: Darren Gough
212.article_body: Former England cricketer Darren Gough has said Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan made batting look easy on a "difficult pitch" in the first England ODI. Gough added, "I am a massive fan of Shikhar Dhawan. He's got a lot of style. He plays some unbelievable shots through the off side." Dhawan scored 31*(54) while Rohit slammed 76*(58) in the game.

213.title: We should be ranked no. 1: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Abdul Razzaq
213.article_body: Talking about Pakistan who're currently ranked sixth in Tests, fourth in ODIs and third in T20Is, ex-Pakistan all-rounder Abdul Razzaq said Pakistan should be ranked number one. "The way we are performing in all...three departments: batting, bowling and fielding, we can see a unity in this side," added Razzaq. "I don't think India can compete with Pakistan," he'd stated.

214.title: Masaba Gupta responds to Instagram user who said 'it's an irony you are in fashion'
214.article_body: An Instagram user commented that Masaba Gupta looked bad and it's an irony she's in fashion. She replied, being in any industry involves talent, hard work and discipline, adding, "As for my face, that's just a pretty bonus (as is my mind that is as sharp as a knife and your bulls**t wouldn't get past it even if you tried)."

215.title: Don't wait for any alliance, gear up for BMC polls: Pawar tells party cadre
215.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday asked his party cadre to gear up preparations for elections to the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). "Don't wait for NCP to stitch up...alliance with any party but start work with an eye on BMC elections," Pawar said. He further asked NCP workers to step up outreach with voters to increase the party's presence.

216.title: Fire breaks out at hotel in Delhi's Paharganj; 10 rescued
216.article_body: A fire reportedly broke out in a room on the second floor of Roma Deluxe Hotel in Delhi's Paharganj on early Thursday morning. The fire tenders have rescued 10 people from the second and third floors of the hotel. "Four fire tenders were rushed to the site. No injuries have been reported so far," Delhi Fire Services said.

217.title: Not yet: Manjrekar on whether Bumrah is in same league as Wasim Akram
217.article_body: On being asked whether Jasprit Bumrah is in the same league as Wasim Akram and Malcolm Marshall, Sanjay Manjrekar said, "Not yet." He added, "Akram and Marshall are the guys who've done it over a long period of time and done it in all conditions. These are all-time greats." Manjrekar, however, stated that Bumrah is currently the most feared pacer.

218.title: US carries out two successful hypersonic missile tests
218.article_body: The US has successfully tested two Lockheed Martin Corp hypersonic missiles recently, the Pentagon said on Wednesday. The US Air Force tested its Air-Launched Rapid Response Weapon (ARRW) booster on Tuesday off the California coast. In a separate test, America's Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency successfully performed the first test of its Operational Fires hypersonic weapon in New Mexico.

219.title: Swimming pool, multi-gym inside park against rules: K'taka HC tells BBMP
219.article_body: Karnataka High Court has ordered the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) against constructing a swimming pool or gym inside the Gayathri Devi Park. Such constructions are prohibited in parks, playfields and open spaces in Karnataka, the HC said. Advocate GR Mohan had alleged that BBMP was doing the illegal construction on proposals given by the 'land mafia'.

220.title: Sri Lanka President boards plane that will take him to Singapore and then to Jeddah
220.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has boarded a Saudi Airlines plane from Maldives that will take him to Singapore and then to Jeddah in Saudi Arabia, Associated Press reported citing Maldives government officials. Rajapaksa had agreed to step down on July 13 after fleeing the country. Sri Lanka Parliament Speaker has said he is yet to receive the resignation letter.

221.title: It's simple, Umran Malik needs time, he's not ready for int'l cricket: Aakash
221.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said pacer Umran Malik is not yet ready for international cricket. "Umran has something that others don't have, extreme pace...but he needs time. He hasn't played a lot of cricket and so he is still raw," added Aakash. Umran had conceded 56 runs in his four overs in the third England T20I.

222.title: Bengaluru police bust inter-state drug racket, drugs worth ₹4 cr seized
222.article_body: Bengaluru City Police's Central Crime Branch (CCB) on Wednesday busted an inter-state drug racket and arrested four persons for smuggling hashish oil and ganja. Police also seized drugs worth ₹4 crore from the accused. According to police, the accused had links with the tribals living in the forests of Andhra Pradesh and used to stay with them to grow marijuana.

223.title: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin, who tested positive for COVID-19, hospitalised
223.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has been admitted to a private hospital in Chennai for investigation and observation for COVID-19-related symptoms. This comes after he said on July 12 that he has tested positive for COVID-19 and isolated himself. Stalin had recently attended a wedding and met a group of people, including the Dravidar Kazhagam leader, K Veeramani.

224.title: 32 killed in K'taka so far amid heavy rains; CM disburses ₹500 cr for restoration work
224.article_body: As many as 32 persons have lost their lives so far in Karnataka due to rain-related incidents. CM Basavaraj Bommai said that ₹500 crore will be disbursed immediately for restoration work of basic infrastructure. CM Bommai added that five people are missing, 34 are injured, more than 300 persons have been evacuated and 14 relief camps have been set up.

225.title: It took me time to get over the Sanjay Dutt hangover: Ranbir on 'Sanju'
225.article_body: Talking about his film 'Sanju' which is a biopic on Sanjay Dutt, Ranbir Kapoor said it took time to get over the "Dutt" hangover. "My eyes became like him, I started smiling...and...walking like him," added Ranbir. Discussing a scene from 'Sanju' where he attends the premiere of 'Rocky', Ranbir had stated, "I was really born as an actor [in it]."

226.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
226.article_body: The IMD has issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states over the next few days. Very heavy rainfall is very likely over Karnataka today. It is very likely over Madhya Pradesh on July 17 and 18 and over Chhattisgarh from July 16 to 18. Odisha, Goa, Maharashtra and Gujarat could also witness heavy rainfall in the next few days.

227.title: He himself knows it hasn't been good, he has got to find his way: Ganguly on Kohli's form
227.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's form, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said, "He himself knows by his own standards it has not been good." "He has got to find his way and become successful, which he has been for the last 12-13 years," Ganguly added. Ganguly further stated that these things happen in sport and have happened to everybody.

228.title: 550 women sue Uber in US, say they were 'raped, harassed' by drivers; firm responds
228.article_body: Uber has been sued in the US by 550 women who claimed they "were kidnapped, sexually assaulted, sexually battered, raped, stalked, harassed, or otherwise attacked by Uber drivers". "Sexual assault is a horrific crime and we take every single report seriously," an Uber spokesperson said. "There is nothing more important than safety," the spokesperson further said.

229.title: If needed, the lion will bite too: Anupam on National Emblem controversy
229.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher has reacted to the controversy over the representation of the National Emblem above the new Parliament building. "If the lion has teeth, it will...show them. This is...the lion of independent India. If needed, the lion will bite too," Anupam tweeted. Several opposition leaders have claimed that the lions were made to look "angry" in the new sculpture.

230.title: Indian Railways books cab for student after train gets cancelled; he shares video message
230.article_body: The Indian Railways booked a cab for an Aerospace engineering student from IIT Madras after his train from Ekta Nagar railway station to Vadodara station was cancelled. Satyam Gadhvi said that due to heavy rains, some portions of the railway tracks connecting Ekta Nagar and Vadodara were washed out. The student shared a video message thanking Indian Railways' staff.

231.title: 11 rescued after wall of abandoned building falls on nearby houses in Pune
231.article_body: As many as 11 persons were rescued after a wall of an abandoned building fell on nearby houses in Pune's Kondhwa Budruk. No casualties or injuries were reported in the incident. "The building is very dilapidated...all the residents have moved out owing to its condition. A side wall of this building fell down on three small houses," an official said.

232.title: Rishi ji was upset after Deepika, Sonam's comments on Ranbir at 'Koffee...': Karan
232.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar revealed Rishi Kapoor was upset after actresses Deepika Padukone and Sonam Kapoor's comments on his son Ranbir Kapoor during their appearance on 'Koffee with Karan' in 2010. "I had to step in to make things alright," he added. "Many times, it has happened...I had to step in to douse the fire after rapid-fire," he stated.

233.title: Anything can be said against ex-VP, nothing against Prez candidate: Cong
233.article_body: Congress leader Pawan Khera said that the situation of the country is such that anything can be said against a Former Vice President but nothing can be said against the political ideologies of a person who is a Presidential candidate. His statement comes a day after BJP accused Hamid Ansari of inviting a Pakistani journalist having links with ISI.

234.title: If Virat Kohli plays in 2nd England ODI, he should replace Shreyas: Jaffer
234.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said if Virat Kohli plays in the second ODI against England, then he should replace Shreyas Iyer in the playing XI. "Suryakumar Yadav batted well in the T20Is. He's in good form, you can't take him out...It's a little unfortunate for Shreyas," added Jaffer. Kohli missed the first ODI due to a groin injury.

235.title: Gupkar alliance, NC greatest hurdle in fight against terrorism: BJP
235.article_body: J&K BJP unit’s spokesperson Girdhari Lal Raina said that the National Conference and Gupkar alliance are the greatest hurdles in the fight against terrorism. "Instead of educating youngsters about the futility of violence and terrorism, these self-centred, power-hungry and pursuers of dynastic politics are instigating people by their inciting statements," Raina added.

236.title: Novak is welcome to Australia: Aus Open director post his deportation
236.article_body: Following Novak Djokovic's deportation from Australia due to being unvaccinated against COVID-19, having arrived for featuring in the Australian Open 2022, the tournament's director Craig Tiley said Djokovic is "always welcome" to Australia. "Djokovic is practically invincible at...Central Stadium," added Tiley. "I was disappointed, I was sad about the way it...played out," Djokovic had said.

237.title: Congress to hold nationwide protest against ED summons to Sonia Gandhi
237.article_body: Congress has announced that it will hold nationwide protest on July 21 when Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi is scheduled to appear before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case. "[Sonia Gandhi] isn't afraid...she will go to...ED office and face this government," said Mallikarjun Kharge. Notably, former Congress President Rahul Gandhi was questioned by ED last month.

238.title: UP woman pours hot oil on 6-yr-old adopted daughter's private parts
238.article_body: A 35-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow was arrested for allegedly causing burn injuries to her six-year-old adopted daughter by pouring hot oil on her private parts. The woman's husband had adopted the girl six months ago as the couple didn't have any children. The woman was, however, unhappy with it and would often misbehave with her, police said.

239.title: Bolein toh bolein kya?: Opposition on list of words banned in Parliament
239.article_body: Reacting to a list of words that are banned in the Parliament, Shiv Sena's Priyanka Chaturvedi tweeted, "Reminded of this meme. Agar karein toh karein kya, bolein toh bolein kya?" TMC's Mahua Moitra tweeted, "Is 'Truth' unparliamentary?" Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said, "All words used by the Opposition to describe the reality of Modi Sarkar now to be considered 'unparliamentary'."

240.title: Ronaldo incredibly frustrated with Man Utd, will leave: Piers Morgan
240.article_body: British broadcaster Piers Morgan said Cristiano Ronaldo is incredibly frustrated by the lack of dedication, desire to win, hunger of the players at Manchester United. "Ronaldo will leave...He is tired," added Morgan. "United are in a pretty bad place...You can't blame Ronaldo for wanting to leave, why would he want to stay?...His frustration has been boiling...throughout the year," he'd stated.

241.title: HC allows impleadment of politicians for Delhi 2020 riots hate speech cases
241.article_body: Delhi High Court allowed the applications impleading several political leaders in connection with alleged hate speeches made during the 2020 Delhi riots. An impleadment plea sought the prosecution of BJP leaders Kapil Mishra, Anurag Thakur, Parvesh Verma and Abhay Verma. Another plea sought for impleadment of leaders including Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, Manish Sisodia and others.

242.title: India's sugar, onion exports affected due to Sri Lankan crisis: Report
242.article_body: The ongoing economic crisis in Sri Lanka has affected the Indian exports of sugar and onion, said a report. Of the 40,000-50,000 tonnes of sugar which Sri Lanka consumes every month, 90% is sourced from India, the report stated. The Indian exporters have stopped sending onions there and the exporters who had traded are yet to receive payments, it said.

243.title: List of words banned in Parliament released
243.article_body: Lok Sabha Secretariat has released a list of words that will be considered unparliamentary, which included 'corrupt', 'lie', 'jumlajeevi', 'nikamma', 'hypocrisy' and 'incompetent'. Words like 'anarchist' and 'dictatorial' will also be expunged if used during debates. The list, however, said that some of the words may not appear unparliamentary unless read in conjunction with other expressions.

244.title: Tourist falls into volcano crater while trying to recover his fallen cellphone in Italy
244.article_body: An American tourist was rescued on Mount Vesuvius near Naples after he slipped into the Italian volcano's crater while trying to recover his fallen cellphone. Reports said that the tourist went off the authorised path to get closer to the crater. The tourist suffered abrasions on his legs, arm and back.

245.title: Ram should be the lead in international films: 'The Witcher...' writer
245.article_body: Screenwriter Aaron Stewart-Ahn, known for writing 'The Witcher: Blood Origin', tweeted that Ram Charan who starred in 'RRR' should be the lead in international films if he features in them. "Hollywood usually doesn't get that...Would love to write a movie for a...star like Ram...just to work with such a great actor and cinematic presence," he added in his tweet.

246.title: What BJP did to tribal rights activist Father Stan Swamy isn’t secret: Ajoy Kumar
246.article_body: Congress’ Ajoy Kumar said BJP is now thinking about Adivasis but what it did to tribal rights activist Father Stan Swamy is not a secret. "The whole country knows BJP's Dalit and anti-tribal policies," he tweeted. Earlier, Kumar said NDA’s Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu represents a "very evil philosophy of India" and should not be made a "symbol of Adivasi".

247.title: Sri Lankan Army refuses to follow instructions of acting President Wickremesinghe
247.article_body: The Sri Lankan Army has refused to follow instructions of acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe to use force against the protestors. Wickremesinghe was appointed as acting President after Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled to the Maldives with his wife. Rajapaksa is heading to Singapore from Maldives, according to reports.

248.title: Actresses are replaced easily, makers wait for yrs for male actors: Taapsee
248.article_body: Taapsee Pannu, speaking about battling sexism in the film industry, has said that the root cause of all the problems that a female actor faces is because they are "easily replaceable". "The ease with which a female actor is replaced is...different from how directors and producers wait for years for a male actor, or write scripts for them," she added.

249.title: I'm confident that Asia Cup will take place in Sri Lanka: Jayasuriya
249.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Sanath Jayasuriya said he's confident that Asia Cup, scheduled to be held in Sri Lanka next month, will take place despite the country's ongoing political and financial crisis. "There's no threat to the tournament. In Sri Lanka, everyone loves cricket," he stated. Meanwhile, the Asian Cricket Council has reportedly kept Bangladesh on standby to host the tournament.

250.title: Will use force as last resort to keep Iran from nuclear weapons: Biden
250.article_body: The US would use force as a last resort to prevent Iran from getting a nuclear weapon, President Joe Biden said. He added that it was a "giant mistake" for the US to quit the 2015 Iran nuclear deal because Iran is "closer to a nuclear weapon now than they were before". The US quit the nuclear deal in 2018.

251.title: 5 abduct waiter for asking them to pay for their meal in Pune; arrested
251.article_body: Five people were arrested for allegedly abducting a waiter who asked them to pay for their meal at a hotel in Pune. According to police, the accused went to a hotel near the New Katraj Tunnel for dinner on Monday. When the waiter asked them to pay for the dinner, they allegedly thrashed him and abducted him on a four-wheeler.

252.title: 92% of eligible Indians late for booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine: Report
252.article_body: According to a Hindustan Times report, 92% of Indians who are eligible for the booster dose of the COVID-19 vaccine have not yet taken these shots. Nearly 594 million adults in India are now "late" for their precaution shots as per data furnished by the Union Health Ministry, the report claimed.

253.title: For everyone, it has become an event film: Kartik on 'Bhool...' success
253.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan was asked the reason why people are still going to theatres to watch his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' despite also being released on an OTT platform. To this, he replied, "It's a community viewing film...For everyone, it has become an event film, that, 'let's go to watch 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', it'll be fun to watch together'."

254.title: Man beats 50-yr-old father to death after fight over loud music in Punjab
254.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested in Punjab's Ludhiana for allegedly beating his 50-year-old father to death. According to the victim's other son, a quarrel broke out between Jagroop Singh and Karam Singh after the latter started playing loud music at night. Jagroop then asked him to stop, following which Karam attacked him with a wooden log.

255.title: Cabinet approves rail link to 3 religious places in Gujarat, Rajasthan
255.article_body: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has approved construction of 116.65-km Taranga Hill-Ambaji-Abu Road rail line, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said. The estimated cost of the project is ₹2,798.16 crore and it will be completed by 2026-27, the minister said. The railway line will connect two states (Gujarat and Rajasthan), and three religious places (Ambaji, Ajitnath Jain and Mount Abu).

256.title: Ukraine cuts ties with N Korea after it recognises separatist regions
256.article_body: Ukraine has said that it's breaking off diplomatic ties with North Korea after it recognised two separatist Ukrainian regions, Donetsk and Luhansk, as independent states. The move "speaks more about Moscow's toxicity than Pyongyang's", Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said, adding, "Russia has no more allies in the world, except for countries that depend on it financially and politically."

257.title: Shaheen is no less than Bumrah, in fact he has more pace: Salman Butt
257.article_body: With Jasprit Bumrah being hailed as one of the best bowlers across formats after his performance against England, ex-Pakistan captain Salman Butt said Shaheen Afridi is no less than the India pacer. "In fact, Shaheen with experience will only get better [as] he has more pace," added Butt. Bumrah registered figures of 6/19 in the first ODI against England.

258.title: Which are the world's most gender-equal countries as India ranks below Nepal, B'desh?
258.article_body: Iceland is the world's most gender-equal country, followed by Finland, Norway, New Zealand, Sweden, Rwanda, Nicaragua, Namibia, Ireland and Germany, according to World Economic Forum. India has been ranked 135, behind Bangladesh (71), Nepal (96), Sri Lanka (110), Maldives (117) and Bhutan (126). In 2021, India ranked 140 out of a total 156 countries on the index.

259.title: Monkeypox symptoms reported in traveller from UAE: Kerala Health Minister
259.article_body: In a first in India, a person who reached Kerala three days ago from the United Arab Emirates (UAE) has developed symptoms of monkeypox, state Health Minister Veena George said on Thursday. "After he developed symptoms of the disease, his samples were sent to the Virology Institute in Pune. The final results are expected by Thursday evening," the minister said.

260.title: I'll eventually be out of the list of world's richest people: Gates on donation plans
260.article_body: Bill Gates has said, "As I look to the future, my plan is to give all my wealth to the Gates Foundation other than what I spend on myself and my family." "I do some...investing in US health care issues...outside the foundation," he added. "I'll move down and eventually off of the list of the world's richest people," he stated.

261.title: Thackeray forced to back NDA's Presidential candidate: Yashwant Sinha
261.article_body: Opposition candidate for Presidential polls Yashwant Sinha said that ex-Maharashtra CM and Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray was "forced" to declare that his party would support the NDA’s candidate, Droupadi Murmu. "I am not only fighting a political party, I am fighting for the government and finally the cat is out of the bag," Sinha added.

262.title: BJP playing dirty politics over upcoming Presidential polls: TMC leader
262.article_body: TMC's Partha Chatterjee said that the BJP is playing "dirty politics" over upcoming Presidential polls. "The NDA nominee was in Kolkata and didn’t ask for votes of Opposition legislators. But BJP leadership has written letters to our MLAs and MPs, seeking their support," Chatterjee added. "When candidate herself hasn't made any appeal, who are they to write letters?" he asked.

263.title: Police attach properties worth ₹100 cr of ex-UP minister in illegal meat factory case
263.article_body: Police on Wednesday attached properties worth over ₹100 crore of BSP leader and former Uttar Pradesh minister Haji Yaqoob Qureshi in connection with a case registered against him for allegedly running an illegal meat factory. An FIR was registered against 17 people, including Qureshi, his wife and sons after illegal meat worth over ₹5 crore was recovered from his factory.

264.title: BMC to hire teachers for ₹150 per hour for government schools
264.article_body: Considering the fact that permanent appointments could take time, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to recruit teachers on an hourly basis for over 800 vacant posts. The teachers will be paid ₹150 per hour and the funds for the purpose will be allotted by the BMC. As per new rules, schools can re-hire retired teachers as well.

265.title: India can't progress if it's caught in shackles of casteism: KT Rama Rao
265.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao on Wednesday said India cannot progress if it is caught in the shackles of casteism. "If caste and religion references are used...when progress is being made in all fields, it will cause serious damage to...country," he said during the launch of book "Charitraputtalo Telangana". He further urged the youth to grow with secular sentiments.

266.title: Which states have most active COVID-19 cases as India reports highest cases in 5 months?
266.article_body: India on Thursday saw 20,139 new COVID-19 cases, the highest daily cases reported since February. West Bengal has the most active COVID-19 cases in the country at 27,496, followed by Kerala with 26,451 active cases and Tamil Nadu with 18,282 active cases. Maharashtra has 16,922 active COVID-19 cases while Karnataka has 6,603 active cases.

267.title: Ex-IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt arrested from jail in 2002 Gujarat riots case
267.article_body: Gujarat Police arrested former IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt from jail in connection with a 2002 Gujarat riots case. He has been accused of allegedly abusing the law by conspiring to fabricate evidence to frame innocent people in connection with the riots. Bhatt was the deputy commissioner incharge of Internal Security at the State Intelligence Bureau when the riots broke out.

268.title: Big B has managed to stay relevant, I follow him earnestly: Madhavan
268.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has revealed that veteran actors Amitabh Bachchan and Clint Eastwood are the two people he follows "earnestly". "At [92], Eastwood is still making movies that he wants to, breaking rules, winning Oscars. Amitabh sir too has always managed to stay relevant," he stated. Recently, Madhavan had featured in 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'.

269.title: Virat Kohli doesn't have the same talent as Rohit Sharma: Imam Ul Haq
269.article_body: Pakistan opener Imam Ul Haq said Virat Kohli doesn't have the same "talent" as Rohit Sharma, adding the latter can change the game in seconds. "Kohli has batted in front of me, so has Rohit...but Rohit has been gifted a lot of time by God," he stated. "It feels...[like] Rohit is batting in replay...He can hit at will," said Imam.

270.title: Water supply to be affected in Thane for next 3-4 days
270.article_body: Thane city will face water shortage over the next three to four days as the Bhatsa Dam has overflown due to continuous heavy rains. The overflowing water has led to waterlogging at the Pise filtration plant in Bhiwandi. The strainer at the plant is clogged with silt and garbage impacting the supply of water to the city.

271.title: Shiv Sena's poll symbol 'bow & arrow' should go to Shinde faction: Athawale
271.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale said Shiv Sena’s poll symbol, 'bow and arrow', should go to Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led faction. "As many as 40 out of 55 Shiv Sena MLAs are with Shinde…I am sure he'll lay claim for symbol because he has [over] two-thirds of MLAs with him," he added. The real Shiv Sena belongs to Shinde, Athawale stated.

272.title: To get back at ex-lover, Mumbai woman steals bike he used for food delivery
272.article_body: A 21-year-old woman from Vikhroli was arrested for allegedly stealing her ex-boyfriend's motorcycle he used for food delivery to get back at him. He'd stopped talking to her after he was arrested for rape on her family's complaint three years ago. The accused stole his bike and promised to tell him its location if he started speaking to her again.

273.title: A businessman offered me ₹25 lakh/month 'to become his salaried wife': Neetu Chandra
273.article_body: Actress Neetu Chandra has revealed that a big businessman told her "to become his salaried wife" for which he would give her ₹25 lakh per month. "Having worked with 13 National award winners and in such big films, today I have no work," she said. "I feel unwanted here after doing so much work," she added.

274.title: India sees 20,139 new COVID-19 cases, highest in 5 months; positivity rate jumps to 5.10%
274.article_body: India has reported 20,139 new COVID-19 cases and 38 deaths in the last 24 hours. This is the first time since February that the daily COVID-19 cases in the country crossed the 20,000-mark. The daily positivity rate in India jumped from 3.68% to 5.10%, while the active caseload in the country reached 1,36,076.

275.title: I'd have loved to play under them, I really would: Pietersen on 'Bazball'
275.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen has said he would've loved to play under the management of England Test coach McCullum and captain Ben Stokes. On England's 'Bazball' approach, Pietersen said, "I love the way the team are playing now. It's exciting, it's positive." He added, "I can only imagine how much happier I would've been, how much better I would've been."

276.title: Actors in OTT have become stars without 24 inches waistline: Kajol
276.article_body: Actress Kajol has said that the OTT platforms have brought out "some fabulous actors". "You have people who are...fabulous actors getting a stage...becoming stars in their own right despite the fact that they don't have a 24 inches waistline...or a 46 inches chest," she added. Kajol stated it's a "fabulous time" for actors as they're getting a lot of exposure.

277.title: Section 144 at all tourist spots in Pune till July 17: District Collector
277.article_body: Pune District Collector has imposed Section 144 at all the tourist spots in the city due to heavy rain forecast till July 17. Accordingly, a gathering of five or more persons has been banned within a one-kilometre radius of forts, waterfalls etc. "It is also prohibited to take pictures while swimming in water or near waterfalls," the order stated.

278.title: Hyderabad Police Commissioner orders transfer of 69 inspectors
278.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand on Wednesday ordered the transfer of 69 police inspectors of various wings. A comprehensive enquiry into the personal life, reputation and integrity of all inspectors picked was also conducted before selecting them for the police units, a release said. This comes days after Marredpally SHO K Nageshwar Rao was arrested in an alleged rape case.

279.title: I wouldn't be disappointed to face Trump again in 2024: Biden
279.article_body: US President Joe Biden said he wouldn't be "disappointed" if there was a rematch between him and ex-President Donald Trump in 2024 Presidential election. Biden added he isn't "predicting" anything as American politics is unpredictable. "I'm not even halfway through my term yet, and so there's a lot of room to figure out what's going to happen," he further said.

280.title: I say 'never again' each time: Amitabh on hosting seasons of KBC
280.article_body: Having hosted television game show 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' for numerous seasons, Amitabh Bachchan said, "'Each time I say never again' and yet it all comes back when the commitment has been made." "The apprehension and fears...arise again...[with] each season [presenting] itself similarly," added Amitabh. "I do hope it all falls into place...Life is a challenge each day," he stated.

281.title: Have decided to learn Gorkhali language: Mamata in Darjeeling
281.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee during her Darjeeling visit said that she has decided to learn Gorkhali language in order to communicate more effectively with the people of the Darjeeling hills. "One of my nephews is getting married to a girl who is a resident of Kurseong...I have decided to learn Gorkhali from her after the marriage," Banerjee said.

282.title: BMC scraps ₹402 crore tender to revamp 54-yr-old Deonar slaughterhouse
282.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) scrapped its ₹402 crore tender for revamping the 54-year-old Deonar slaughterhouse. This is the fifth tender that Municipal Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal has scrapped this year, with a total value of ₹1,464 crore. Earlier, Chahal scrapped a ₹569 crore tender for laying utility trenches and ₹291 crore for making additional animal enclosures, among others.

283.title: 8 members of an Indian family swept away at Oman beach, 2 killed, 3 missing
283.article_body: A video showed a family of eight Indian expatriates being swept away by the strong waves at Mughsail Beach in Oman, out of which three were rescued. The bodies of a 42-year-old Maharashtra man and his six-year-old son were retrieved, while the search was on for his nine-year-old daughter and the other two members, whose details were not known.

284.title: BJP confusing people on population issue to deviate from real priority: Mayawati
284.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati said that BJP is confusing people on the issue of population control to deviate from "real priority". "At a time, when people are limiting their needs and are forced to lead a stressful life singed by extreme poverty and rising unemployment, is it wise of BJP to confuse people with long-term issues like population control?" she asked.

285.title: Nearly 2,000 kg of single-use plastic seized in Bengaluru since ban
285.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has seized 1,926.8 kg of single-use plastic in its eight zones since the nation-wide ban imposed on July 1. While 1,319 cases of violations were registered by the civic body, ₹8,36,300 was collected as fine during the same period, data showed. Maximum cases (316) were registered in BBMP's West zone, followed by East zone (273).

286.title: Few seats left for online degrees at Manipal University Jaipur
286.article_body: NAAC A+ accredited Manipal University Jaipur has announced that the last few seats are left for its UGC-entitled online degrees like MBA, B.Com, BBA & more. The university stated that students can get a degree online while working or balancing other commitments and benefit from scholarships, career mentorship, free access to Coursera, placement assistance and more.

287.title: Chelsea sign Raheem Sterling from Manchester City for £47.5m
287.article_body: Chelsea have signed England forward Raheem Sterling on a five-year contract from Manchester City in a deal reportedly worth £47.5 million ($57m). The deal makes Sterling the highest earner at Stamford Bridge. The 27-year-old, who had joined Manchester City in 2015, played 47 games in all competitions last season, scoring 17 times and providing nine assists.

288.title: IMD predicts extremely heavy rainfall for Pune city for 24 hours
288.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Wednesday predicted extremely heavy rainfall in Pune city and neighbouring areas for the next 24 hours till Thursday. "City witnessing heavy rainfall due to strong westerly winds and an offshore trough between the southern coast of Gujarat and the northern coast of Konkan," it added. "Packed isobars still persisting over the Arabian Sea," IMD stated.

289.title: India releases statement after Mahatma Gandhi's statue vandalised in Canada
289.article_body: After a statue of Mahatma Gandhi was vandalised in Canada's Richmond Hill, the High Commission of India in Ottawa said, "We are deeply anguished by this hate crime that seeks to terrorize the Indian community." "It has led to increased...insecurity in the Indian community here. We have approached the Canadian government to...ensure perpetrators are brought to justice swiftly," it added.

290.title: NMMC and PMC declare holiday for schools on July 14
290.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) and Panvel Municipal Corporation (PMC) have declared a holiday for all schools in their jurisdiction for Thursday (July 14) due to heavy rainfall in the city. All private and government-run primary, secondary and higher secondary schools will be closed, as per the order. NMMC area received 65.7 mm rainfall till 7.30 pm on Wednesday.

291.title: 30 dummy IEDs planted across Delhi to check police alertness, 12 found
291.article_body: Delhi Police Special Cell planted 30 dummy improvised explosive devices (IEDs) to check police alertness. Notably, only 12 were detected by the public, private security guards and local police. "The first batch of 15 dummy IEDs was planted on June 12 across Delhi's districts and 10 of them were detected," a senior police officer said.

292.title: Pune veterinary doctor defrauded of ₹35 lakh in chit fund scam
292.article_body: A veterinary doctor from Pune's Kalewadi was cheated of ₹35 lakh in chit fund fraud, police officials said on Wednesday. The doctor, Ashok Krushna Bhondwe, was advised to invest in the scheme by the accused upon being assured of monthly returns. Bhondwe then transferred ₹35 lakh to the accused's account, who cited market crash and didn't pay back any interest.

293.title: 5 people abduct hotel staffer, refuse to pay food bill in Pune; held
293.article_body: Five people were arrested on Tuesday for allegedly attacking and kidnapping a hotel staffer in Pune. As per police, the accused had dined at Hotel Ranmala before refusing to pay the entire food bill. They abducted the staffer when he asked for payment. The staffer has been rescued. One of the accused was also arrested in a murder case earlier.

294.title: Heatwave conditions spark wildfires in southern Europe
294.article_body: Europe battled a spate of wildfires on Wednesday as heatwave conditions linked to climate change sparked new blazes and impeded firefighting operations. Forest fires were reported from Portugal, Spain, France and Turkey - rendering to waste several thousand acres of forest land. In Portugal, about 120 people required medical attention and two sustained serious burns.

295.title: Free COVID-19 precaution dose PM Modi's gift to nation: JP Nadda
295.article_body: BJP President JP Nadda said that Centre's decision to provide free COVID-19 precaution doses to all adults was one of the gifts of PM Narendra Modi to the nation. The Union Government announced that from July 15 all adults will be given free precaution doses for 75 days. This drive is part of the 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' celebrations.

296.title: 7-year-old tests positive for Zika virus in Maharashtra's Palghar
296.article_body: A 7-year-old girl tested positive for Zika virus in Maharashtra's Palghar district, the health department said. The girl is a resident of Ashramshala in Jhai, the department further added. Preventative and control measures along with surveillance, vector management, treatment and health education are being undertaken. The first case of Zika virus was reported in Pune in 2021.

297.title: 3 more people die of Japanese Encephalitis in Assam, death toll rises to 16
297.article_body: Three more people have died due to Japanese Encephalitis (JE) in Assam. The state reported 17 more cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total tally of cases to 121 since July 1, the National Health Mission said. With three new deaths, the death toll due to the disease in Assam has risen to 16.

298.title: UP sub-inspector suspended as video of him beating a man goes viral
298.article_body: A sub-inspector from Uttar Pradesh's Balrampur district was suspended on Wednesday for allegedly assaulting a man and pointing his service pistol at him. This comes after a video of sub-inspector Arun Kumar Gautam beating the man inside a clinic went viral. The man had gone to the clinic for treatment after his motorcycle collided with the sub-inspector's bike on Tuesday.

299.title: 7-yr-old Thane boy cycling on terrace falls into creek; feared drowned
299.article_body: A seven-year-old boy was cycling on the open terrace of his chawl in Thane when he lost his balance and fell into a creek on Wednesday. Rescue team couldn't find Rishi Usva till late evening. It's feared that he drowned in the flooded waterbody. Usva, the son of a vegetable vendor, was reportedly riding a cycle for the first time.

300.title: SC to hear pleas against Karnataka HC order on hijab ban next week
300.article_body: The Supreme Court will hear the petitions challenging the Karnataka High Court order on hijab ban next week. On March 15, the Karnataka High Court passed a judgement stating that wearing hijab was not an essential religious practice. Advocate Prashant Bhushan, appearing for the petitioners, mentioned the matter for urgent listing before the Chief Justice of India N V Ramana.

301.title: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee serves pani puris in Darjeeling
301.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee made pani puris at a roadside stall in Darjeeling and served them to tourists. She visited a stall run by women from a Self Help Group (SHG) and showed her expertise in preparing the street food. Mamata was in Darjeeling to participate in the swearing-in ceremony of the new members of the Gorkhaland Territorial Administration.

302.title: Charred body found in a burnt car in Karnataka's Udupi district
302.article_body: A burnt car with a charred body was found in an isolated area at Henaberu in Byndoor taluk of Karnataka's Udupi district, police sources said. The police have not been able to identify the deceased as the body was charred beyond recognition and only skeletal remains were found. The frame of the car and the number plate were also charred.

303.title: Switzerland advises citizens against non-urgent travel to Sri Lanka
303.article_body: Switzerland's Foreign Ministry on Wednesday advised its citizens to avoid non-urgent travel to Sri Lanka. "The political situation is confused and tensions have increased. A deterioration of the situation must be expected," it added. This comes after Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country for the Maldives amid a severe economic crisis.

304.title: Russian President Putin to visit Iran next week
304.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin will be in Iran next week, as part of the Astana format  - a trilateral meeting of Russia, Turkey and Iran. Putin's trip follows US President Joe Biden's ongoing visit to the Middle-East. Earlier, the US said Iran is preparing to arm Russia with several hundred drones capable of carrying weapons for use against Ukraine.

305.title: European Space Agency celebrates launch of Vega-C rocket
305.article_body: The European Space Agency celebrated the first flight of its Vega-C rocket on Wednesday. Vega-C is an upgraded module of the Vega rocket introduced in 2012, with the latest version capable of carrying heavier payloads while burning lesser fuel. The agency said Vega-C will be used to send Earth observation satellites and an uncrewed robotic laboratory.

306.title: CBI to probe alleged killing of BJP activist in WB after 2021 polls
306.article_body: The CBI has taken over the investigation into the alleged killing of BJP activist Prasenjit Das in Kolkata amid the post-poll violence in West Bengal in 2021. Das was found hanging outside his residence by his mother last year. The CBI has re-registered a case of abetment to suicide against nine people, including two staffers of Baguiati Police Station.

307.title: Women to be worst hit by cost-of-living crisis: WEF
307.article_body: The World Economic Forum on Wednesday said the global cost-of-living crisis caused by increases in fuel and food prices will hit women the hardest. The Geneva-based forum added that the estimated number of years required to attain gender parity has now decreased to 132 years from 136 years. It considered economic opportunity, education, health and political empowerment as defining factors.

308.title: Kohli's Under-15 days' roommate DB Ravi Teja meets him after 6 years in UK, shares pics
308.article_body: Virat Kohli's Under-15 days' roommate DB Ravi Teja took to Twitter to reveal he met Kohli after six years in the UK. Sharing pictures from their meeting, he wrote, "First thing he tells me is 'Chiru Kaise hai tu?'...I used to watch Chiranjeevi's songs on TV & he danced to them...From then on Chiru was nickname we gave each other."

309.title: India defeat Japan 3-1, finish 9th in women's hockey World Cup 2022
309.article_body: Navneet Kaur scored a brace as the Indian women's hockey team defeated Japan 3-1 to finish ninth in hockey World Cup 2022. Navneet scored two field goals in the 30th and the 45th minutes, while Deep Grace Ekka converted a penalty corner in 38th minute in the classification match. India had finished eighth in the women's hockey World Cup 2018.

310.title: Amber Heard is 'abso-f**king-lutely' a gold digger: Actor Mickey Rourke
310.article_body: Actor Mickey Rourke has called Amber Heard a "gold digger" in an interview. Asked about Johnny Depp's trial, he said, "I was in a situation...where I was blamed for something I didn't do...I felt...bad for somebody trying to get chopped down by some gold digger." When asked if that's what he thought Amber was, he stated, "Abso-f**king-lutely."

311.title: Bengaluru park sign against 'anti-clockwise' walking goes viral
311.article_body: A public advisory at a Bengaluru park which asks citizens to not walk in the "anti-clockwise" direction has gone viral on social media. The notice reads, "No jogging, no walking, no anti-clockwise walking." The post attracted comments, with a user asking, "Is nagin dance allowed?", to which another said, "Only if you do it clockwise."

312.title: Villagers demand enhanced compensation for Jewar Airport land acquisition
312.article_body: The land acquisition for the Jewar International Airport in Uttar Pradesh has hit a roadblock with about 3,200 villagers demanding enhanced compensation and resettlement. Acknowledging the impasse, MLA of Jewar Dhirendra Singh said he will take up the issue with Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. The Jewar Airport is expected to be one of the biggest in the world after completion.

313.title: Three arrested for murdering gutka trader in Bengaluru: Reports
313.article_body: Bengaluru police have arrested three people, including a couple, for allegedly murdering a gutka trader from Bihar. The body was found in a drain on July 5, wrapped in plastic, media reports quoted officials as saying. The deceased's wife is among the accused and there is a financial payment and adultery angle in the killing, officials said.

314.title: EU allows transit of sanctioned Russian goods to Kaliningrad via rail
314.article_body: European Union (EU) said on Wednesday that sanctioned Russian goods can transit through bloc's territory by rail to Russia's exclave Kaliningrad, adding that such trains should be checked. This comes amid tensions between Russia and EU member state Lithuania over transit ban of such goods amid Ukraine war. The only rail line connecting Kaliningrad to mainland Russia passes via Lithuania.

315.title: Lost 2021 polls because of manipulators in our party: AIADMK's EPS
315.article_body: AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami said that the party lost 2021 state elections because of manipulators in AIADMK itself. "CM Stalin thinks he can knock our party with the help of traitors in AIADMK. But it won't happen, we'll form government again," Palaniswami said. Palaniswami's comment comes after he took control of the party as its interim General Secretary.

316.title: 3 killed, 3 injured as truck falls into gorge in Himachal's Lahaul
316.article_body: Three people were killed and three others sustained injuries after the truck in which they were travelling fell into a gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Lahaul-Spiti district on Wednesday, an official said. The injured were taken to Keylong civil hospital, State Disaster Management Director Sudesh Mokhta said. Indian Army jawans, BRO jawans and the police helped to pull out the bodies.

317.title: Owner of South African bar where 21 teens died arrested: Police
317.article_body: The owner of the bar in South Africa's Eastern Cape province where 21 teenagers died last month has been arrested, the police said on Wednesday. Notably, the forensic teams are yet to reveal their conclusions on how the teens died. Two employees of the bar have also been arrested, the police added.

318.title: 120 SL-bound planes land at Kerala airports amid crisis, Scindia praises
318.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia showered praise on Trivandrum and Kochi airports as 120 Sri Lanka-bound airplanes landed there on Wednesday. "The airports have gone beyond their call of duty...The gesture will go a long way in furthering ties with our neighbour," Scindia said in a tweet. Sri Lanka declared a state of emergency today amid ongoing anti-government protests.

319.title: I'm not gay but Bruce Lee was the only guy I wanted to kiss: Ram Gopal Varma
319.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma recently revealed that he wanted to kiss the legendary martial artist and actor Bruce Lee. Varma said he watched 'Enter The Dragon' as a young boy, and right from that point he has been in awe of his work. "I'm not gay, but he (Bruce Lee) was the only guy I wanted to kiss," he added.

320.title: West Bengal witnessing extreme appeasement: Governor Dhankhar
320.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Wednesday criticised the state government and said the state is witnessing extreme appeasement. "Our state has serious problems of governance," Dhankhar said. "I appeal to civil society and intelligentsia to speak about this serious problem of governance," he said, adding that this appeasement will destroy democracy.

321.title: 60,000 arrested in Bihar for violating liquor ban this year: Police
321.article_body: Nearly 60,000 people were arrested across Bihar between January and June this year for flouting the state's ban on liquor, the police said on Wednesday. Of these, nearly 10% of the arrests took place in Patna district. More than 16 lakh litres of liquor was seized and over 7,000 vehicles carrying alcohol were impounded, according to official data.

322.title: CRPF seizes over 600 IEDs, 495 detonators from Naxals in Bihar
322.article_body: The Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) recovered arms and ammunition from Naxals in Bihar's Gaya last week, the force said on Wednesday. CoBRA commandos of the CRPF recovered over 600 improvised explosive devices (IED) and 495 detonators during the anti-Naxal operation, an official said. One AK series of rifle and 250 rounds of ammunition were also recovered.

323.title: Healthcare platform MediBuddy acquires healthtech startup Clinix
323.article_body: Digital healthcare platform MediBuddy acquired healthtech startup Clinix, which offers online consultation with doctors in rural areas. Clinix caters to the healthcare needs of the rural population across 20 tier II and tier III cities and helps them overcome several difficulties to avail quality healthcare. In June 2020, MediBuddy had merged with online doctor consultation provider DocsApp.

324.title: Hyenas kill 13 goats in Chhattisgarh's Durg district
324.article_body: A pack of hyenas killed 13 goats and injured eight others during an attack in a village in Chhattisgarh's Durg district, an official said on Wednesday. Notably, it is the first such attack reported in the area, according to Divisional Forest Officer Shashi Kumar. Villagers have been advised to remain alert, Kumar said.

325.title: 24 children fall sick after eating midday meals at school in UP
325.article_body: At least 24 children were hospitalised in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Wednesday after having midday meals at school. Basic Shiksha Adhikari (BSA) Shubhum Shukla said that a lizard was found in the meals consumed by the students. Parents of the students reached the hospital and demanded strict action against the school headmaster and two cooks for their negligence.

326.title: Congress sees politics in National Emblem: K'taka CM Bommai
326.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday criticised Congress over the National Emblem controversy and said the party sees politics in it. "Its fierceness shows our way of thinking," Bommai said. This comes after Congress criticised the BJP over the National Emblem cast atop the new Parliament building and accused the Centre of changing the nature and character of Ashokan lions.

327.title: BJP turning Amarnath Yatra into a 'political issue': Mehbooba Mufti
327.article_body: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti accused the Centre of turning Amarnath Yatra into a "political issue". "The environment does not permit more than 5,000 pilgrims every day, but they sent thousands of people there. The result was that the cloudburst took place," Mufti said. She claimed the administration was hiding the actual number of deaths in Friday's cloudburst incident.

328.title: Indian-origin Sunak wins most votes in 1st round of voting to succeed Johnson as UK PM
328.article_body: The UK's former Finance Minister Rishi Sunak won the most votes in the first round of voting to succeed Boris Johnson as leader of the Conservative Party and UK Prime Minister. Sunak scored 88 votes, ahead of Penny Mordaunt (67 votes) and Truss Liz (50 votes), reported Reuters. Finance Minister Nadhim Zahawi and former cabinet minister Jeremy Hunt were eliminated.

329.title: BJP only national party today, others reduced to families: Nadda
329.article_body: BJP is the only national party today, while others have been reduced to families and individuals, said BJP president JP Nadda on Tuesday. While addressing the party's training camp in Rajasthan, Nadda expressed confidence that BJP will form the government in the state with a thumping majority in the Assembly polls next year.

330.title: 5 people, including 2 aged over 70, die of cholera in Amravati
330.article_body: Five people, including two women, have died due to cholera in Maharashtra's Amravati district since July 7, 2022, when the disease broke out due to heavy rainfall. Three of the deceased were aged between 24 and 40, while two were aged over 70. A total of 181 people in the district were recently diagnosed with the water-borne disease.

331.title: 'Send him back to Sri Lanka': Gotabaya faces protests in Maldives
331.article_body: Sri Lankan expatriates in Maldives staged a protest against President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Wednesday, demanding that Rajapaksa be sent back to Sri Lanka. "Dear Maldivian friends, please urge your government not to safeguard criminals," one of the protest banners read. Rajapaksa fled to Maldives earlier today with his wife amid raging protests in Sri Lanka over the ongoing economic crisis.

332.title: Many Himachal BJP leaders suffocated within their party: Congress
332.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress President Pratibha Singh on Wednesday said many BJP leaders in the state are eager to join the Congress as they feel "suffocated" due to infighting in their party. Her statement comes a day after former Himachal Pradesh BJP President Khimi Ram joined the Congress. Singh also said that people are "fed up" with BJP's policies and decisions.

333.title: 2 pictures of Jupiter taken by world's most powerful telescope leaked
333.article_body: A NASA team leaked two pictures of Jupiter taken by the world's most powerful telescope, the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST). The images were included in a NASA commissioning document to show that the telescope's NIRCam can track moving targets. These pictures weren't a part of the first batch of full-colour images taken by JWST, that was released on Tuesday.

334.title: CA Final results to be out by July 16
334.article_body: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) will declare results of CA Final, held in May this year, on either July 15 evening or July 16 morning. The marks will be uploaded on the official website – icai.org. Meanwhile, Chartered Accountants Foundation examinations, which were postponed at Silchar examination center, have been rescheduled between July 14 and July 16.

335.title: Geeta Kapur shares post for Farah, says 'Thank you for holding my hand'
335.article_body: Choreographer Geeta Kapur took to Instagram on Wednesday and thanked mentor Farah Khan Kunder on the occasion of Guru Purnima. Sharing a picture with her, Geeta wrote, "Thank you for always holding my hand...thank you for never letting me fall...thank you for sharing your craft..love you forever @farahkhankunder there will never be another for me HAPPY GURU POORNIMA MAMMA."

336.title: Flash floods kill 39, including 9 children, in Afghanistan: UN
336.article_body: The United Nations (UN) said on Wednesday said that flash floods have killed at least 39 people, including nine children, in Afghanistan. The heavy rains have damaged or destroyed around 2,900 houses, he added. The rains have caused land to slide, exposing unexploded ordnance from four decades of war and conflict, it further said.

337.title: Who are the highest-ranked Indian batters across formats in latest rankings?
337.article_body: As per the latest rankings released by ICC, world number five Test batter Rishabh Pant is the top-ranked Indian batter in Test cricket, followed by Rohit Sharma, who is overall ranked ninth. Meanwhile, Virat Kohli, who's world number three ODI batter, is the top-ranked Indian batter in ODI cricket. Meanwhile, Suryakumar Yadav is the top-ranked Indian batter in T20I cricket.

338.title: MP govt to organise 'Youth Mahapanchayat' in Bhopal on July 23, 24
338.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government will organise a 'Youth Mahapanchayat' in Bhopal on July 23 and 24. According to an official statement, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said the objective of the gathering is to provide a platform to youth wherein they can suggest solutions to various social, economic and political challenges in the state. Chouhan urged youth to participate in large numbers.

339.title: SC to hear plea to declare Ram Sethu a heritage monument on July 26
339.article_body: The Supreme Court on July 26 will hear BJP leader Subramanian Swamy's plea seeking a direction to the Union government to declare 'Ram Sethu' a national heritage monument. Swamy submitted he had won the first round of litigation where the Centre accepted the Ram Sethu's existence. Ram Sethu is a chain of limestone shoals between Tamil Nadu and Sri Lanka.

340.title: Don't follow orders of Sri Lanka's acting Prez: Ex-Army chief to military
340.article_body: Sri Lanka's ex-Army chief Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka on Wednesday urged the country's armed forces to not follow the orders of acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe. Fonseka, who is a Member of Parliament, claimed that directives issued by Wickremesinghe are "against the Constitution". Fonseka also urged the armed forces to refrain from using their weapons against innocent and unarmed citizens.

341.title: B Praak remembers his 2nd son whom he lost during birth, says 'You're my angel'
341.article_body: Singer B Praak has penned a note remembering his second son whom he lost during birth and called him his angel. Taking to Instagram, he wrote, "I never got to hear your cry. I never saw your beautiful eyes...I never saw your innocent smile...But you're my angel son and you will forever be missed until we meet again...Mera Beta Fazza."

342.title: EV startup Ather Energy posts 411.9% revenue growth for FY22
342.article_body: Electric Vehicle startup Ather Energy said that they generated ₹408.5 crore in revenue for FY22, up 411.9% compared to ₹79.8 crore in the previous fiscal. With the cost of EV parts and raw materials rising, the startup's loss also widened to ₹344.1 crore from ₹233.3 crore in FY21. Last year, Ather expanded to 34 stores across 28 cities.

343.title: Content monetisation platform ConsCent raises ₹13.26 crore
343.article_body: Content monetisation platform ConsCent has raised ₹13.26 crore in a bridge round, the company announced. The round was led by Inflection Point Ventures and saw participation from Varanium Capital, RiSo Capital, SucSEED Indovation Fund, among others and some angels. The startup provides technology to India Today Group, Outlook India Group, The New Indian Express, among others.

344.title: Centre must win hearts of Kashmiris: Farooq Abdullah
344.article_body: National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah on Wednesday said the Centre must win the hearts of the people in Kashmir to end terrorism. He condemned the killing of a police official in Srinagar on Tuesday, seeking “handsome compensation” for the victim's kin. Abdullah said the government must open talks with Pakistan to bring peace to the Valley.

345.title: Want to thank all men who broke my heart & stomped over it: Pooja Bhatt
345.article_body: Speaking about her past relationships, actress Pooja Bhatt said, "God bless all the men that I have been with because I think I have taken something from each one of them." "I especially want to thank the people who broke my heart and stomped all over it...Because that is what reintroduces you to yourself," she added.

346.title: Kanpur rioters paid ₹1,000 to pelt stones, ₹5,000 to hurl bombs: SIT
346.article_body: A probe by Special Investigation Team (SIT) revealed that rioters were allegedly paid ₹500-₹1,000 to pelt stones and ₹5,000 to hurl petrol bombs in Kanpur last month. Miscreants who agreed to participate in arson were assured free legal assistance, the SIT claimed. The miscreants were allegedly trained for eight-nine days. The riots occurred after Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

347.title: Restore order: Sri Lankan Acting Prez to military amid protests
347.article_body: Sri Lankan Acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe instructed the country's armed forces and police to "restore order" as thousands of anti-government protesters stormed into his office on Wednesday. Protesters were seen breaching military defences to enter the premier's office and raise national flags there, witnesses said. Wickremesinghe declared a state of emergency in Sri Lanka earlier today.

348.title: Former US NSA John Bolton admits to having planned coups in foreign countries
348.article_body: Ex-US National Security Adviser (NSA) John Bolton said on Tuesday that he had helped plan attempted coups in foreign countries. Bolton made the remarks on live TV while discussing the congressional hearing into the January 6, 2021 attack on the US Capitol. On being asked to get into specifics, Bolton mentioned Venezuela, adding, "It turned out not to be successful."

349.title: Why is the July 13 full Moon called the Buck Moon?
349.article_body: According to The Old Farmer's Almanac, the July 13 full Moon is called the Buck Moon because the antlers of bucks or male deer normally grow around this time. "Early summer is normally when the new antlers of buck deer push out of their foreheads in coatings of velvety fur," said NASA. It's also referred to as the Thunder Moon.

350.title: Biden lands in Israel as part of his 1st trip to Middle East as Prez
