350.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Wednesday arrived in Israel as part of his first official tour of the Middle East since taking office. The US will deepen Israel's integration into the Middle East, Biden said after landing at Ben Gurion Airport. Biden, who first visited the region in 1973, noted that this is his 10th visit to Israel.

351.title: Cong should apologise: Minister on 'evil philosophy' remark on Murmu
351.article_body: Tribal Affairs Minister Arjun Munda on Wednesday criticised Congress leader Ajoy Kumar's "evil philosophy" remark on NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu, stating that Congress should apologise for it. "Tribes weren't recognised by Congress even [as it was] in power for...long time," he added. Kumar had said that Murmu represents "evil philosophy" and shouldn't be made "symbol of tribals".

352.title: Court allows Aryan Khan to get back his passport, cancels bail bond
352.article_body: A Special NDPS court on Wednesday allowed Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan to get back his passport which was in its custody as per the bail condition in the Cordelia cruise drugs case. The court passed an order after NCB gave no objection to the same. The court noted that bail bond stands cancelled and his surety stands discharged.

353.title: US inflation hits new 4-decade high of 9.1% in June
353.article_body: The consumer price index (CPI) in the US jumped in June 2022 at its fastest year-over-year pace since the end of 1981, the US Bureau of Labor Statistics reported. Inflation rose 9.1% in June 2022 from the same month a year ago. Excluding food and energy, the core CPI rose 5.9%, compared with the 5.7% estimate.

354.title: What Deepika Padukone did in Gehraiyaan, I did 15 years ago: Mallika
354.article_body: Mallika Sherawat compared films 'Murder' and 'Gehraiyaan' and said she has never been appreciated for her acting and people always focus on her body. "Such hue and cry was created when I did 'Murder'. People said all kinds of things about the kiss and...bikini," she added. "What Deepika Padukone did in 'Gehraiyaan', I did that 15 years ago," Mallika said.

355.title: Will ensure CAA isn't implemented if elected Prez: Yashwant Sinha
355.article_body: Opposition Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Wednesday said that if he is elected, he will ensure that the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) is not implemented. "Earlier, the government gave the excuse of COVID-19, but even now they have not been able to implement it because it is an Act foolishly drafted in a hurry," he said.

356.title: I expected Alia to know who the President of India is: Karan Johar
356.article_body: Karan Johar revealed that he didn't disclose the questions from the 'Koffee With Karan' quiz during which Alia Bhatt named Prithviraj Chauhan as the President of India. "I...didn't want them to screw up and...they still did. I didn't give them the quiz, thinking they knew the basics and then, of course, we...know about the big Alia Bhatt goofup," he added.

357.title: Video shows Shivpuri ADM calling democracy a mistake amid MP polls
357.article_body: A video showing Shivpuri Additional Collector Umesh Shukla calling voting and democracy mistakes has gone viral. Shukla made the remark when he was approached by voters who were facing difficulties because of expired ballot paper amid elections in Madhya Pradesh. He said, "Democracy is [India's] biggest mistake...What did you get by voting? Several corrupt leaders have been born by voting."

358.title: There is a fascist threat to democracy in Sri Lanka: Acting Prez
358.article_body: In his first televised address since being appointed as Sri Lanka's acting President on Wednesday, Ranil Wickremesinghe said that there is a fascist threat to democracy in the country. "Those who are in my office want to stop me from discharging my responsibilities...We can't let them tear up our Constitution," he added. Anti-government protesters had stormed Wickremesinghe's office.

359.title: BJP's Malviya sending doctored video: Cong's Ajoy over his Murmu remark
359.article_body: Responding to his statement over NDA Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu, Congress leader Ajoy Kumar on Wednesday said that BJP's IT cell in-charge Amit Malviya has doctored the video, which is being misrepresented. "Droupadi Murmu is a decent person, but she represents an evil philosophy of India. We shouldn't make her a symbol of tribals," Kumar had earlier said.

360.title: Loan agents harass Andhra woman with morphed pics, she kills self
360.article_body: A married woman in her early 20s hanged herself to death at her residence in Andhra Pradesh on Monday. Before her death, she said in a self-recorded video that she's committing suicide due to harassment by online loan agents. She claimed they threatened to send her morphed nude pictures to her relatives if she didn't repay a loan of ₹20,000.

361.title: Solomon Islands PM meets Aus, NZ leaders amid China pact worries
361.article_body: Solomon Islands PM Manasseh Sogavare met his Australian and New Zealand counterparts, Anthony Albanese and Jacinda Ardern, in separate bilateral meetings for the first time since Solomon Islands signed a security pact with China. Notably, Australia and New Zealand had voiced concerns over possible Chinese military presence in Solomon Islands due to the pact. The pact was signed in April.

362.title: Hyd man trying to place warning sign board run over by speeding car
362.article_body: A man in Hyderabad was run over by a speeding car while he was trying to place a signboard to warn motorists of a hole in the middle of a busy street. The incident took place on Tuesday when the deceased walked across the middle of the road to put back the warning sign board after it had fallen off.

363.title: I never invited or met him: Hamid Ansari on Pak journalist's claim of spying on India
363.article_body: Former Vice President Hamid Ansari, reacting to Pakistani journalist Nusrat Mirza's claim that he was invited to India by Ansari, called it "a litany of falsehood." "It's a...known...fact that invitation to foreign dignitaries...are on...advice of the government...I never invited him or met him," said Ansari. Mirza claimed he passed on information collected during his India visits to ISI.

364.title: 2 commit burglaries in Mumbai, spend money on family trips; held
364.article_body: A 42-year-old man and his brother-in-law were arrested for burglaries in Mumbai, who used to spend money on sightseeing with their family members after committing crimes, police said on Wednesday. "The duo used to do a recce of commercial establishments and flats before targeting them," a Mumbai Police official said. Police recovered cash and several mobile phones from their possession.

365.title: Euro falls below $1 for the first time in nearly 20 years
365.article_body: The euro dropped below parity against the US dollar on Wednesday for the first time in almost 20 years. Euro was trading at around $0.998 at 12:45 pm GMT, down 0.4% in 24 hours, marking its lowest level since December 2002, Reuters reported. The euro has lost more than 10% so far this year.

366.title: Man blessed with male child after 3 daughters kills 19-yr-old boy as human sacrifice in MP
366.article_body: A 32-year-old man named Ramlal allegedly killed a 19-year-old boy named Divyansh Kol to offer him to goddess as a human sacrifice after being blessed with a male child in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district. Ramlal had three daughters and he wanted a male child. As per police, Ramlal hacked Divyansh to death and left his body in a temple.

367.title: Wasim Jaffer's 'Alexa, please play Bumrah' tweet goes viral, Alexa reacts
367.article_body: Reacting to Jasprit Bumrah's performance in the first ODI against England, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "'Alexa, please play Jasprit Bumrah', 'Sorry, Jasprit Bumrah is unplayable'," after which the tweet went viral. The official Twitter handle of the Amazon's cloud-based voice service reacted to Jaffer's tweet, writing, "Now playing 'U Can't Touch This' in honour of the Boom Boom Bumrah."

368.title: Ukraine will not cede territory to reach peace deal, says Foreign Min
368.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba on Wednesday ruled out ceding territory to Russia as part of any peace deal. "The objective of...this war...is to liberate our territories, restore our territorial integrity, and full sovereignty in the east and south of Ukraine," Kuleba said. Currently, there are no peace talks being held between Russia and Ukraine, he added.

369.title: Assam minister, others targeted in 'gift card scam'; FIR filed
369.article_body: Assam minister Bimal Borah has lodged an FIR with the police after unidentified fraudsters created fake WhatsApp accounts of him and other senior officials to cheat people. "Messages were being sent [on my behalf] to...[people], asking them to transfer money by purchasing some gift vouchers," Borah said. "I've asked the police to investigate and trace the criminals," he added.

370.title: Bihar DSP arrested for involvement in BPSC exam paper leak racket
370.article_body: A Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) from Bihar has been arrested in connection with the leak of Bihar Public Service Commission's question papers for civil services (preliminary) examinations in May. DSP Ranjit Kumar Razak allegedly used to get people appointed in state government services through BPSC exams for money. "He was in touch with...key players in this racket," police said.

371.title: Minor boy engaged in child labour rescued in Hyderabad
371.article_body: The She Teams of Rachakonda Police along with the Muskan team rescued a minor boy, a native of  Tamil Nadu, who was engaged in child labour, the police said on Wednesday. The company's owner and the boy's parents were counselled about child labour, the police added. The minor boy worked in the Industrial Development Area in Nacharam, they said.

372.title: Family refuses to take body of CRPF jawan who shot himself in Raj
372.article_body: CRPF jawan Naresh Jat's relatives have refused to accept his body after he shot himself in Rajasthan on Monday. They've demanded that first his colleagues be arrested for allegedly instigating him to commit suicide. They also want a government job for Naresh's six-year-old daughter on attaining majority, lifelong pension to his wife and a guard of honour at his funeral.

373.title: Day of expressing gratitude to Gurus: PM Modi on Guru Purnima
373.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday extended his greetings on Guru Purnima to the nation, calling it a day of expressing gratitude to all exemplary Gurus who have inspired us and mentored us. "May the blessings of our Gurus take India to newer heights," PM Modi tweeted. He also extended his wishes on the occasion of 'Ashadha Purnima'.

374.title: Agritech startup nurture.farm partners with SBI General Insurance
374.article_body: Agritech startup nurture.farm will partner with SBI General Insurance and Future Generali India Insurance Company to provide 1.9 million farmers with insurance solutions, the company said. Having received a licence from the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority, the startup can now provide farmers with insurance solutions at lower costs. The firm aims to help 2 million farmers in FY23.

375.title: T'gana govt extends holidays for schools, colleges amid heavy rains
375.article_body: The Telangana government has announced the extension of holidays for schools and colleges until July 16 amid incessant rains in the state. Educational institutions will reopen on July 18, a government circular stated. This comes after the India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted heavy to very heavy rains for the next three days across the state.

376.title: I used to pass on information collected during my visits to India to ISI: Pak journalist
376.article_body: Nusrat Mirza, a Pakistani columnist who has visited India many times during 2007 to 2010, claimed that he used to pass on information collected during his visits to Pakistan's ISI. He said he received various privileges from the foreign affairs department of Pakistan during his visits to India. Mirza further claimed that former Vice President Hamid Ansari had invited him.

377.title: 46-yr-old shopkeeper assaulted in Delhi, family suspect role of owner
377.article_body: A 46-year-old shopkeeper was critically injured after he was allegedly assaulted by some people in Delhi's Kinari Bazaar area, police said. According to the statement given by the victim's father, four to five people carrying iron rods had enquired about Deepak (shopkeeper), alleging that he had teased a girl. Deepak's father said he suspected the involvement of the shop owner.

378.title: Hyderabad Mayor instructs GHMC officials to stay alert amid rains
378.article_body: Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal conducted a review meeting and instructed zonal commissioners of Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) to be vigilant amid incessant rains in the city. She directed officials to keep field staff on alert and attend to complaints received from stranded citizens. She appealed to citizens to beware of electric poles and avoid taking shelter under trees.

379.title: NIA raids 9 premises in connection with Udaipur murder case
379.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Tuesday conducted raids at nine locations linked to the accused and suspects in the Udaipur murder case. An NIA spokesperson said the agency seized mobile phones, laptop, SIM cards and other incriminating materials during the raids. Earlier, two of the accused said they killed Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal to avenge an insult to Islam.

380.title: We were neighbours in Goa: Janhvi Kapoor on how she bonded with Sara
380.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor spoke about how she and Sara Ali Khan became friends during their appearance on 'Koffee With Karan'. "We were neighbours in Goa...One day we started talking. We ended up talking till...morning," she said. Janhvi recalled she was impressed with Sara during their trip to Disneyland. "She broke every line. I kept thinking, 'she's so cool'," Janhvi added.

381.title: WB Governor Dhankhar behaves in a communal manner: TMC MLA Ali
381.article_body: TMC MLA Idris Ali on Wednesday accused West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar of being communal and alleged that he behaves in a communal manner. Ali had previously sparked controversy for alleging that PM Narendra Modi will meet the same fate as Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. "Prime Minister Modi will also resign and flee," he had said.

382.title: Pune schools to remain shut on July 14 in view of heavy rain
382.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has announced that all schools under its jurisdiction will remain shut on Thursday in view of heavy rain prediction in the region. However, the teaching and non-teaching staff of all civic schools will have to report to their respective schools to take part in disaster management-related work of the PMC.

383.title: Singapore viewed as an attractive target for terror attacks: Govt
383.article_body: The Singapore government on Wednesday said that the city-state is viewed as an "attractive target" for terror attacks by both foreign terror outfits and lone radicalised actors. The Internal Security Department (ISD) in its annual report said that terrorists may make their way to new conflict zones after the pandemic. The government has asked citizens to remain on high alert.

384.title: Man arrested for raising peacocks at his residence in Karnataka; adult bird seized
384.article_body: A man identified as Manju Nayak has been arrested on charges of raising peacocks at his residence in Kamegowdanahalli village in Karnataka's Mysuru district. The peacock is India’s national bird and is protected under the Indian Wildlife Act 1972. During a raid at Manju's residence by the Mobile Vigilance Squad of the Karnataka Forest Department, an adult peacock was seized.

385.title: Haryana to build science city on 50 acres of land in Gurugram
385.article_body: The Haryana government will set up a science city on around 50 acres of land in Gurugram, an official statement said. The project will be completed with the help of the Centre, it added. Once it's set up, students from the state and other parts of the country would get an opportunity to practically learn scientific principles, an official said.

386.title: Man gets 20 yrs rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting 2 girls in Guj
386.article_body: A special court in Gujarat's Rajkot district sentenced a man to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting two minor girls. The girls, aged three and five years, were playing alone near their houses when the accused lured and assaulted them, Public Prosecutor Ghanshyam Dobariya said. The incident was reported in Rajkot's Gondal taluka on May 20 this year.

387.title: I'm filing a complaint against Team India, jokes Mahindra over quick win vs England
387.article_body: After a total of 44 overs were played in first ODI between England and India, with India chasing down the target in 18.4 overs, Anand Mahindra jokingly tweeted, "I'm filing a complaint against Team India for such a brutally dominant victory in such a short time." He added, "Because by the time I switched on the TV...the match was done."

388.title: Pet pitbull dog attacks, kills 82-year-old woman owner in Lucknow
388.article_body: An 82-year-old woman was mauled to death by her pet dog at her house in Lucknow, police said on Wednesday. According to police, Sushila Tripathi, a retired school teacher, was on the roof of her house on Tuesday morning when her pitbull attacked her. The domestic help found her lying in a pool of blood and informed her son.

389.title: Greek news outlet targeted in arson attack
389.article_body: The office of Greek news outlet Real News and Real FM was set on fire in Athens on Wednesday in a suspected arson attack, the media firm said. No deaths were reported, but several people with respiratory issues were taken to hospital. The news outlet linked the attack to imprisoned anarchist Yannis Michailidis.

390.title: I'm the same girl who visits temple & wears bikinis at the beach: Sara
390.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan opened up about how she's 'constantly evolving' in life. Speaking about herself, Sara said, "The girl going to a temple is the same girl wearing bikinis at the beach is the same girl who hates living away from her mother for 45 days while shooting." "She'll keep surprising you because she's still surprising herself," Sara added.

391.title: Russian, Ukrainian officials to discuss export of grain stocks
391.article_body: Russian and Ukrainian military officials will meet in Istanbul, Turkey on Wednesday to discuss the export of Ukrainian grain which is held up due to the ongoing war between the two countries. The United Nations organised the meeting to mitigate a potential grain shortage globally. Turkey has offered a safe route through the Black Sea to move the stocks.

392.title: 4 pilgrims from UP feared drowned in Ganga river in Uttarakhand
392.article_body: Four pilgrims from Uttar Pradesh were feared drowned after their vehicle fell into the Ganga river in Tehri district of Uttarakhand on Wednesday morning. A search operation was launched, however, the victims haven't been found yet, police said. The four were reportedly returning from Kedarnath when their car fell into the river, the relatives of one of the victims said.

393.title: Liverpool's Nunez trolled for missing open goal-scoring chance vs Man Utd
393.article_body: Liverpool's Darwin Nunez has been trolled on social media for missing an open goal-scoring opportunity against Manchester United in their pre-season game. In the 88th minute, Nunez received the ball on rebound after Mohamed Salah's effort but failed to score, kicking the ball over the bar. "Time to bring him out of my fantasy team," wrote a user on Twitter.

394.title: There isn't a single woman in Delhi who hasn't faced eve-teasing: Sanya
394.article_body: Actress Sanya Malhotra, who will reportedly feature in SRK-starrer 'Jawan', said, "I am from Delhi...but I don't feel safe there...I don't think there is a single woman in Delhi who hasn't faced eve-teasing." "I feel more safe in Mumbai," added Sanya. "I have been through so many weird situations when I was in college [in Delhi]," she had stated.

395.title: England need to think hard about pitches they want to use for next ODIs: Jaffer
395.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said England need to think hard about the pitches they want to use for the next two ODIs against India. Jaffer added that England's plan to leave grass on the wickets proved costly for hosts as "India have three quality pacers". England were dismissed for 110 runs in the first ODI on Tuesday.

396.title: Bengaluru-based startup Hyperface raises $9 mn in seed funding
396.article_body: Bengaluru-based credit-card-as-a-service platform, Hyperface has raised $9 million in a seed funding round. The round led by 3one4 Capital and Flipkart Ventures, saw participation from existing investors Better Capital and Global Founders Capital and new investors Groww and Rebalance Angel Community. It was founded by ex-banker Aishwarya Jaishankar and Ramanathan RV, former Co-founder of Juspay.

397.title: FM interested in Uranus, Pluto rather than tackling inflation: Congress
397.article_body: A day after the government released its inflation data, Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh on Wednesday criticised Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman for retweeting pictures from NASA's Webb Telescope. "She has an interest in Pluto, Jupiter and Uranus. Unfortunately, our Finance Minister is showing the way to Pluto, Uranus...and is unable to show...way forward to our economy," Vallabh said.

398.title: Bengaluru Police arrest two-wheeler thief; recover 25 vehicles
398.article_body: As many as 25 vehicles were recovered after Bengaluru Police arrested a notorious two-wheeler thief on Wednesday. Vinayak Patil, Deputy Commissioner of Police (North Bengaluru), shared a photo of the 25 recovered vehicles on Twitter, which include 21 motorcycles and four scooters. The vehicles were found to be registered in different states, including Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka etc.

399.title: Over 1,700 hectares burnt as wildfires rage in southwestern France
399.article_body: Around 600 firefighters supported by six water-bomber planes are battling to contain two wildfires in southwestern France, which have already burnt over 1,700 hectares of land and prompted the evacuation of thousands of tourists. "Important human and material resources are being deployed to master the fires," authorities said. France is currently suffering from a second heatwave of the year.

400.title: Succession beats West Wing, bags most Emmy acting nominations in 2022
400.article_body: The nominations for the 74th Emmy Awards were announced on Tuesday, July 12. 'Succession' received a leading 25 Emmy nominations. It also received the most acting nominations thus beating 'The West Wing', which held the previous record. 'Ted Lasso' topped the comedy and 'The White Lotus' earned the top spot in the limited series categories with 20 nominations each.
